intro: Licania hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy licania, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Licania hirsuta is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests.
